2005.question: For the construction of a gravity dam choose the most favorable geological condition of the following:
options: Strata dipping downstream in narrow valley
Strata dipping upstream in wide valley
Strata dipping downstream in wide valley
Strata dipping upstream in narrow valley
2005.answer: Strata dipping upstream in narrow valley

2005.question: Artesian condition results when the:
options: piezometric surface is above ground level
water table is above ground level
2005.answer: piezometric surface is above ground level

2006.question: A hill face slopes at an angle 40° due east. The joint set most likely to cause landslide is the one dipping at:
A rock that is porous but not permeable is:

2007.question: Of the following alternatives, the most suitable condition for a road cut in a hilly terrain is where the foliations:
options: dip towards the slope at high angle
dip towards the slope at low angle

2007.question: Which of the following rocks can form good aquifers?

2008.question: Which part of the arch dam experiences maximum stress?
In an underground mine, shaft and ore body are connected by:
Rapid mass movement of water-saturated regolith is called:
In hydrological context, a porous and impermeable earth mass is known as:

2009.question: What is the porosity of sandstone with solid rock volume of 70%?

2010.question: Match the hydrological terms in Group I with those in Group II. Group I: P. Aquifer, Q. Aquiclude, R. Aquitard, S. Aquifuge. Group II: 1. Non porous, non permeable, 2. Porous, non permeable, 3. Poorly porous and poorly permeable, 4. Porous and permeable.

2011.question: Leakage through rock fractures below a dam can be reduced significantly by:
Adit is an underground excavation, which is:
options: A horizontal opening giving access to main tunnel
A horizontal opening used for transporting water to powerhouse
A vertical opening used for multiple purposes
An inclined opening providing access to main tunnel
2011.answer: A horizontal opening giving access to main tunnel

2011.question: The ratio of volume of underground water released under gravity to the total volume of saturated aquifer is called:

2012.question: The mass movement process in which cohesive blocks of earth move on a failure plane with concave-up geometry, is known as:
Which one of the following tunnel alignments is considered geologically favorable?
options: Tunnel through the core of a synform with parallel tunnel- and fold axes
Tunnel through the core of an antiform with parallel tunnel- and fold axes
Tunnel through a synform with tunnel- and fold axes perpendicular to each other
Tunnel through an antiform with tunnel- and fold axes perpendicular to each other
2012.answer: Tunnel through the core of an antiform with parallel tunnel- and fold axes

2012.question: Match the lithological units in Group I with hydrogeological nomenclature in Group II. Group I: P. Massive granite, Q. Shale, R. Clayey sandstone, S. Gravelly sandstone. Group II: 1. Aquitard, 2. Aquifer, 3. Aquiclude, 4. Aquifuge.

2014.question: Which one of the following rocks has maximum compressive strength?
In which of the following rocks does groundwater flow obey Darcy's law?

2015.question: A mine excavation made along the strike of a 2 meter thick tabular ore body dipping 30° is called:
A 10 cm³ sandstone block has a mass of 20 grams. If the average density of sand grains is 2.5 g/cm³, the porosity (in percent) of the sandstone is _______.
A mineral has a weight of 4.5 grams in air and 3.2 grams in water. Assuming density of water to be 1 g/cm^3, the specific gravity (up to 2 decimal places) of the mineral is -------.
A unit which is semi-permeable and does not yield any significant quantity of groundwater is called:

2016.question: A gravity dam with E-W axis is to be constructed in a narrow river valley between two N-S trending parallel ridges. The river is flowing from south to north. The lithology of the area is represented by 2 to 5 m thick metasedimentary rocks – quartzite, phyllite, and schist. Which of the following geological conditions will be most suitable?
options: Beds in both the ridges strike N-S but dip towards each other
Beds in both the ridges strike N-S but dip in opposite direction to each other
Beds in both the ridges strike E-W and dip towards N (downstream)
Beds in both the ridges strike E-W and dip towards S (upstream)
2016.answer: Beds in both the ridges strike E-W and dip towards S (upstream)

2016.question: Weight of a 10 cm³ medium grained sandstone block with 20% (v/v) porosity, in dry state is 26g. The density of the block when fully saturated with water is __________ g/cm³.

2017.question: Check dams are constructed in association with the main dam in the:
options: Upstream of the main dam to check the siltation of the reservoir
Downstream of the main dam to check the siltation of the reservoir
Upstream of the main dam to check the seepage from the reservoir
Downstream of the main dam to check the seepage from the reservoir
2017.answer: Upstream of the main dam to check the siltation of the reservoir

2017.question: Rivers that receive water from groundwater seepage are termed as:
A geological formation neither containing nor transmitting water is termed as:

2018.question: The mass of a fully dried rock sample of volume 100 cm³ is 300 g. The mass of the sample, when fully saturated with water of density 1.00 g/cm³, is 325 g. Assuming no volume change, the computed porosity of the rock is _____% (answer in one decimal place).

A confined sandstone aquifer with a uniform cross-sectional area of 7 m² and a hydraulic conductivity of 2 m/s, transmits water across a hydraulic gradient of 3.2. Assuming steady-state Darcy’s flow, the volumetric flow rate through the aquifer is ______ m³/s (answer in one decimal place).

2019.question: A 50 kg granite boulder gets dislodged from a cliff of height 20 m and undergoes an absolute vertical free fall. If the acceleration due to gravity is 10 m/s², the boulder will hit the ground with a velocity of __________ m/s.

Mass and volume of a fully dried soil sample are 500 g and 250 cm³, respectively. The average density of the particles in the soil sample is 2.5 g/cm³. The void ratio of the soil sample is ____________%.
Which of the following statements is/are correct with reference to subsurface water? (Multiple Select Question)
options: The perched water table occurs below the water table
Vadose water occurs in the zone of aeration
For significant groundwater underflow, the medium must be highly permeable
Intersection of the water table with the land surface can result in the formation of a spring
answer: Vadose water occurs in the zone of aeration
For significant groundwater underflow, the medium must be highly permeable
Intersection of the water table with the land surface can result in the formation of a spring

2019.question: Two vertical wells penetrating a confined aquifer are 200 m apart. The water surface elevations in these wells are 35 m and 40 m above a common reference datum. The discharge per unit area through the aquifer is 0.05 m/day. Using Darcy’s law, the coefficient of permeability is _______ m/day.

2020.question: Choose the correct statement(s): (Multiple Select Question)
options: Gravity dam is a rigid structure, straight or slightly curved in places.
Arch dams are commonly built on very strong foundations.
Buttress dam chiefly consists of reinforced concrete slab that slopes upstream.
Earth dams have a concrete wall curved with convex face pointed towards the upstream.
answer: Gravity dam is a rigid structure, straight or slightly curved in places.
Buttress dam chiefly consists of reinforced concrete slab that slopes upstream.

2020.question: The grain density (of solids only) and bulk density (solids + voids) of a sandstone sample are 2.7 gm/cm³ and 2.3 gm/cm³, respectively. The total porosity (in %, correct to two decimal places) of the sample is ____.
Hardness of groundwater is determined by:
Choose the correct statement:
options: Porosity of weathered granite is less than a crystalline granite.
Coarse sands have high porosity and high permeability.
Clays have high porosity and high permeability.
Ground water table does not fluctuate with water recharge.
2020.answer: Coarse sands have high porosity and high permeability.

2020.question: An aquifer has a cross sectional area of 1000 m² and a hydraulic gradient of 0.01. If water is flowing from the aquifer at a rate of 10 m³/sec, the hydraulic conductivity (in m/sec) of the aquifer is _______.
